Document Text: Try video calls to connect on special occasions like Passover, Easter & Ramadan to virtually visit with family, friends & faith-based communities. Grocery shop once per week & consider donating to a local food bank to foster the holiday spirit. Learn more https://t.co/PYFYrib1IB https://t.co/PNnoQk77zh

Extending my best wishes to Toronto's Jewish community who will begin the celebration of #Passover this evening. This year, residents are encouraged to celebrate #Passover separately in their own homes in an effort to stop the spread of #COVID19. Chag Sameach! https://t.co/XevMOUDzi2

During Passover, Easter and Ramadan, please find creative ways to stay connected with family, friends and faith-based communities without visiting in person. Plan ahead for grocery shopping and consider donating to a local food bank. Learn more: https://t.co/PYFYrib1IB https://t.co/IdPbWJ45OA

While many have strong ties to #Alberta, now is not the time for BCers to visit. It's not the time for the ppl of AB to visit #BC. We need stay home, connect virtually & avoid unnecessary travel to ensure that BC will con’t to bend the curve and protect our friends & families.

Chag Pesach Sameach to Ontario’s Jewish community! Passover honours the strength and resilience of the Jewish people, a message many can relate to today. I wish you all a peaceful Seder. Please stay safe, and stay home. https://t.co/6yHm1JqPAw
